intro: Secamone micrandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central tube. Secamone micrandra is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
